Job Title: Senior Housing Asset Management & Development Manager

Location: Greater Chicago Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, General Business, Management

Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Housing Asset Management and Development Manager who will lead efforts in asset management of the organization’s Assisted Living Portfolio and support the development team’s planning and execution of future assisted living projects. The role will require proactive identification of issues and opportunities, excellent communication skills and teamwork skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects at a time.
Key Responsibilities:
Asset ManagementLead regular operational update calls with 3rd party operators.Review and analyze monthly financial statements and operating reports – create consolidated assisted living portfolio report for distribution and presentation to Evergreen’s executive leadership team.Conduct regular site visits to properties, keeping staff motivated and encouraged, checking the accuracy and objectivity of reports that we receive from our operating partners.Drive efficiency and performance of the operating team.Effectively problem solve with operating team and report to ownership on issues, opportunities, risks.Lead opening activities on behalf of OwnershipParticipate in professional organizations, helping drive policy and progress of the AALF industry
DevelopmentPre-developmentSupport market research efforts, analyzing demand factors and competition in target markets for AALFCompile and organize data, create reports to drive decisions on target markets and landTrack competitive facilities, outreach and investigation into facility rents, occupancy, and incentivesParticipate in meetings with local government regarding zoning and other local approvals needed in the predevelopment phaseFunding ApplicationsLead the prep of funding applications, with focus on financing and operationsWork with 3 rd parties on applicable reportsOperator and financing due diligenceMaintain dd checklists, review and compile due diligence material relating to finance and operationsSupport financial analysis of the development. Lead calls with operator to review pre-closing budgets, incorporate into the financial modelClosing supportWork with the development manager to manage the closing process, including due diligence, financing review, model updates, and closing packagesPost Closing, Pre-openingLead regular pre-opening calls with operatorSupport marketing efforts, lead strategic initiatives to drive deposits and lease-upCoordinate pre-opening activities with operating partner
Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Urban Planning, Real Estate Development, Business Administration, or related field (Master's degree preferred).Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in affordable housing or senior housing asset management, operations, or developmentKnowledge of affordable housing programs, financing, and compliance requirements.Experience with Medicaid waiver assisted living operations.Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
